statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.headline: McNeese St. 67, Texas State 65
article.story: SAN MARCOS, Texas (AP) -- Aldryan Wardell broke free for a dunk with 15 seconds remaining to seal McNeese State's 67-65 victory over Texas State on Thursday night. McNeese State (9-14, 4-6 Southland) pushed its 36-24 halftime lead to a comfortable 20-point margin with 14 minutes to play. But Texas State mounted a comeback, capped by Brent Holder's 3-pointer at 1:04 to tie the game at 63. John Pichon hit a jumper with 40 seconds left to put the Cowboys back on top 65-63. The Bobcats turned the ball over on their next posession, leading to Wardell's dunk to push McNeese State's lead to 67-63. Dylan Moseley was fouled on a 3-point attempt on the Bobcats' next possession. With six seconds to play, Moseley made his first two free throws and then intentionally missed the third. Texas State came down with the rebound but McNeese State's John Ford stripped the ball and held it until the final buzzer. Jarvis Bradley led McNeese State with 15 points. Ford added 13 and Troy Aaron had 10. Kleon Penn led the team with nine rebounds and four blocks. Holder came off the bench to lead Texas State (8-15, 3-7) with 14 points. Brandon Thomas led the team with nine rebounds and four steals. McNeese State recorded 40 percent field-goal shooting for the game to 28 percent for the Bobcats. The Cowboys won the rebounding contest 44-38. McNeese State's Quentin Gonzales was ejected for a flagrant foul at 6:23 in the first half.
